thread.title: Italian or not, you do not want to miss this!
thread.title_full: Italian or not, you do not want to miss this!

author: eTN Global Editor
title: Italian or not, you do not want to miss this!
text:
Italian or not, you do not want to miss this! Adv: 
Aug 07, 2015 Adv: 
MONTREAL, Canada - From August 7th to August 16th, Montreal's Italian Week invites you to discover its lineup and immerse yourself in the Italian-Canadian culture. Gastronomy, fashion, music, opera, art, car exhibits and much more! Thanks to its diverse programming, Montreal's Italian Week has been a part of the city's cultural scene for twenty-two years. This year's events: 
August 7, 8, and 9 - Rivière-des-Prairies (A. Cipriani Park) Concerts and animation 
August 7, 8, and 9 - Centre commercial Le Boulevard Concerts and Fiat exhibit 
August 7 to 14 - Centre Leonardo da Vinci, Casa d'Italia Film screenings and art exhibit (CLDV) 
August 8 - Notre-Dame-De-Grâce (Georges-Saint-Pierre Park) Concerts, soccer and bocce tournaments, community dinner, and inflatable games for children 
August 9 and 10 - Lasalle (Ouellette Park) Film screening and concerts 
August 10 and 11 - Cinéma Beaubien Film screenings 
August 12 and 13 - Cinéma du Parc Film screenings 
August 13 - Saint-Léonard (Wilfrid-Bastien Park) Concerts and Fiat exhibit 
August 14, 15, and 16 - Little Italy (from Jean-Talon to Saint-Zotique) 
Concerts, outdoor opera, fashion show under the stars, Fiat exhibit, art exhibition, kiosks, inflatable games, street animation 
About Montreal's Italian Week 
Presented by Loto-Québec, Montreal's Italian Week is a cultural festival held annually throughout the city. Attended by more than 390 000 festival-goers annually, the festival offers a large variety of shows and activities celebrating the beauty and diversity of the Italian-Canadian community through art, music, gastronomy, fashion and folklore. This year, the 22nd edition of the festival will be held from August 7 to 16, 2015. All of the events are free of charge.
